docs.lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, June 6 -- Delegates to the United Nations environmental conference approved today an appeal to all countries to minimize the release of toxic metals and chemicals into the environment.

headline.main: U.N. Parley Appeals for Curbs On the Release of Toxic Metals; U.N. Parley Asks Care on Toxic Effluents

docs.abstract: Japanese delegates to UN environmental conf, Stockholm, rept that ailment known as ouch ouch disease, or itai itai, which attacks bones and causes them to break with normal body movements, has been traced to cadmium poisoning; 132 cases, 32 deaths reptd
docs.snippet: STOCKHOLM, June 6 -- Delegates to the United Nations environmental conference approved today an appeal to all countries to minimize the release of toxic metals and chemicals into the environment.

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times
